abstract: General Electric said Wednesday that it had paid 126.3 billion yen ($1.05 billion) for the Japanese leasing company Sanyo Electric Credit. G.E. paid 3,250 yen a share for 97 percent of Sanyo Credit’s stock, the company said. The company bought the shares from Sanyo Electric and two Goldman Sachs units. G.E. is focusing on lending to companies after the Japanese government tightened consumer credit rules.
lead_paragraph: General Electric said Wednesday that it had paid 126.3 billion yen ($1.05 billion) for the Japanese leasing company Sanyo Electric Credit. G.E. paid 3,250 yen a share for 97 percent of Sanyo Credit’s stock, the company said. The company bought the shares from Sanyo Electric and two Goldman Sachs units. G.E. is focusing on lending to companies after the Japanese government tightened consumer credit rules.

headline.main: G.E. Buys Rest of Japan’s Sanyo Credit
